snippet: The Shanghai-based advertising company delisted from the Nasdaq two years ago but is returning to the market through a “backdoor listing” in China.
abstract: DealBook Online; Chinese ad firm Focus Media lists on Shenzhen Stock Exchange with value of 45.7 billion renminbi, or $7.4 billion.
lead_paragraph: The Shanghai-based advertising company delisted from the Nasdaq two years ago but is returning to the market through a “backdoor listing” in China.

headline.main: Focus Media Reaches $7.4 Billion Deal to List in Shenzhen
